message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.CR 

The paper proposes a novel method for person re-identification (Re-ID) that incorporates local and global information and integrates gradual cues between them. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also explores a dynamic training scheme to learn discriminative identity representation, which indicates that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The use of multi-loss training and the focus on improving performance on challenging datasets such as CUHK03 suggest that the paper may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and cryptography and security (cs.CR) sub-categories.
